basics.name: Korin Eckstrom
basics.label: Bioinformatician
basics.summary: Experienced bioinformatician with a demonstrated history of working in both the biotech/pharma industry & academic settings. Skilled in R & Statistical Data Analysis, Whole Exome Sequencing, Metagenomics, RNA-seq, and other forms of Next Generation sequencing. Experience working with data from major sequencing platforms, including Illumina, Oxford Nanopore, and PacBio.

work.name: Genentech
work.summary:
Bioinformatics analyst within the Early Research & Development arm of Genentech.
Maintained and added features to production workflows for analysis of clinical trial, preclinical,
and safety assessment data, from sample registration to final deliverable. Involved in cloud
migration efforts & strategy, benchmarking of new tools and workflows, and development of
visualization applications for company-wide use.

education.institution: University of Vermont, Burlington, Vermont, US
courses:
Evaluating The Resistome And Microbial Composition During Food Waste Feeding
And Composting On A Vermont Poultry Farm

awards.title: Northeast SARE Research Grant
awards.summary:
Table to Farm: Using Shotgun Metagenomics to Quantify Antibiotic Resistance on
Farms Feeding Food Scraps to Laying Hens
